titleStmt.title: R. Gudgell to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2197

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
R. GUDGELL
ATTY. AT LAW
NOTARY PUBLIC
OWINGSVILLE BATH CO. KY
Owingsville Ky
September 12th 1865,
His Excellency
Gov. Thos. E. Bramblette
Frankfort Ky --
Dear Sir,

By the charter of the town of Owingsville approved March 5th 1850, Session acts 1849-50. page 477, Section 6 provides "That the Governor shall by and with the advice and consent of the Senate appoint a suitable person police Judge of the said town."
By an order of the Board of Trustees for the said town this day held it was ordered. "That the governor of Ky. be recommended to appoint and commission Will. L. Vissher as Police Judge of said town".

Being Clerk of the said Board I am directed to ask you to send me a commission tofor Mr. Visscher. He is a young man of promise, a student in my office, and I trust you will consider the matter without delay.

Very Resply
R. Gudgell
Police Judge
Owingsville
Will L Visscher
apptd 15 Sept/65
